headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Officers Attached to the Paraguay Expedition--Satisfactory Settlement of the Angle--Central--American Difficulty--The Treaty with the American Colonization Society, &c. INTERESTING FROM WASHINGTON. Magnetic telegraph Company's Offices--Nos. 43 Wall-street and 181 braodway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following officers have been ordered to report immediately for the Paraguay service: Commanders--THORNTON A. JENKINS, (now secretary of the Lighthouse Board,) JOHN B. MARCHAUD, DAVID B, RIDGELY, A.L. CARE, ALEXANDER M. PENNOOK. and THOMAS T. HUNTER.

headline.main: THE STATEN ISLAND WAR.; Further Arrests and Proceedings in the Court. VISIT OF THE MAYOR TO THE RUINS. How the Matter is Viewed by the Rebels. PREPARATIONS FRO A MILITARY ENCAMPMENT. Affairs at Quarantine Yesterday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The events of yesterday at Quarantione were very much a repetition of what occurred there on the previous day, with the exception that the place was visited by General SANFORD and Colonel LYON, to make arrangements for locating the army of occupation, which is to be sent to the Island under the requisition of the Governor.

docs.snippet: The Republican and American State Conventions assembled at Syracuse yesterday, and though they both worked with commendable diligence the business effected was scarcely more than preliminary. The prospect of a coalition is better than was premised by...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican and American State Conventions assembled at Syracuse yesterday, and though they both worked with commendable diligence the business effected was scarcely more than preliminary. The prospect of a coalition is better than was premised by our Tuesday night's dispatches, though it is not yet considered sure.

headline.main: GREAT TELEGRAPHIC FESTIVAL.; LETTER FROM THE HON.CHAS. SUMNER. Addresses from the Hon Hamilton Fish, the Hon, Joseph R. Chandler, Messrs. Tefft, Squier, Seeley, Munroe, Atwill, Greenough, Spencer, Murray and Thayer, Speech of the American Minister at Versailtes. Banquet to the Inventor of the Electric Telegraph. GREAT SPEECH OF PROF, MORSE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Professor MORSE, who arrived in Paris from the United States the same day the news was received of the successful landing of the Atlantic Cable at Valentia and at Newfoundland, has just received from his fellow-citizens at Paris an ovation in honor of that event, of which any man might be proud.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: SIR: For the benefit of a large slacs of suffers, I am induced so submit a few suggestions on the subject of Heart Disease. Instances of sudden death, in which the victims are stricken down, while apparently in...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: SIR: For the benefit of a large slacs of suffers, I am induced so submit a few suggestions on the subject of Heart Disease. Instances of sudden death, in which the victims are stricken down, while apparently in the possession of fu?? health and strength, and, as it is generally supposed, without a moment's warning, are frequent.

docs.lead_paragraph: PERJURY.-LOUIS H. PUTNAM, a colored marl, was arrested yesterday by Officer WM. H. BROWN, of the Second Precinct, and committed to answer a charge of perjury, committed on tile celebrated libel suit brought by the accused against the President of the Colonization Society. He was committee to answer. FIRE.-At 31/2 o'clock, yesterday morning, a lire broke out in tile premises of SAMUEL LOCKHEAD,

headline.main: EUROPE.; ADDITIONAL DETAILS OF NEWS. ARRIVAL OF THE FULTON

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Fulton, J. A. WOTTON, Esq., Commander, from Havre and Cowes, on Wednesday, Aug. 25, at 3 P.M., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The Vanderbilt arrived off Cowes on Wednesday morning, Aug. 25. The Vigo passed Holyhead on Tuesday night, Aug. 24.

docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamer Fulton, from Havre and Cowes on the 25th, arrived at this port yesterday morning, Her news had been anticipated by telegram from Cape Race. We have added, however, various items of interest, and extracts, which will attract the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamer Fulton, from Havre and Cowes on the 25th, arrived at this port yesterday morning, Her news had been anticipated by telegram from Cape Race. We have added, however, various items of interest, and extracts, which will attract the reader. Nothing had been heard of the steamship Asia at Halifax up to the time of going to press this morning.

docs.snippet: Matters at Quarantine during yesterday remained very much in state quo. Up to 12 o'clock the fifty persons appointed by the Board of Health of the town to guard the gates of Quarantine had not made their appearance.

headline.main: THE QUARANTINE WAR.; POLICE REINFORCEMENTS FOR THE ISLAND, Further Arrests and Proceedings in Court. THE MILITARY CALLED OUT. GOV. KING'S PROCLAMATION. The County of Richmond Declared in a State of Insurrection.

docs.lead_paragraph: Matters at Quarantine during yesterday remained very much in state quo. Up to 12 o'clock the fifty persons appointed by the Board of Health of the town to guard the gates of Quarantine had not made their appearance.

docs.snippet: REBUILDING QUARANTINE.--Mayor TIEMANN has lost no opportunity for speaking his mind plainly in relation to the Quarantine, since the destruction. The Mayor boldly declared at tile outset that he was in favor of adding some thirty more acres to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: REBUILDING QUARANTINE.--Mayor TIEMANN has lost no opportunity for speaking his mind plainly in relation to the Quarantine, since the destruction. The Mayor boldly declared at tile outset that he was in favor of adding some thirty more acres to the Quarantine ground, surrounding them with a high brick wall,
